Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <TonyL> @sg777 Following this guide https://github.com/sg777/bet/tree/poker on fresh Ubuntu 18.04 machine.
On step  ``` ./configure --with-boost=/usr/local/``` from `# Installing CHIPS`
At first I get: ```checking for Berkeley DB C++ headers... default
configure: error: Found Berkeley DB other than 4.8, required for portable wallets (--with-incompatible-bdb to ignore or --disable-wallet to disable wallet functionality)
```
Then if I run ``` ./configure --with-boost=/usr/local/ --with-incompatible-bdb```
```checking for boostlib >= 1.47.0... yes
checking whether the Boost::System library is available... yes
configure: error: Could not find a version of the boost_system library!
```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <TonyL> Worked for me:
```./configure --with-boost=/usr/include/boost/ --with-boost-libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --with-incompatible-bdb```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <TonyL> Should I change branch to `poker` on this step?

$ git clone https://github.com/sg777/bet.git```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> how actually it works is there are two nodes DCV(Dealer) and BVV(Blinder) and the playing nodes connect to DCV where the table formation happens...then players, DCV and BVV involve in the process of deck shuffling..then card distribution with round betting happens
